content.text: Lake and Mountains.  CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD past island in lake.
High Angle V.W. Car moving along road - CAMERA TILTS UP with it.

scene: EXT. COLORADO MOUNTAINS & ROAD - DAY - L.S.

content.text: Mountains and Road - V.W. Car moves away along road - CAMERA TRACKS after it.
L.S.  V.W. Car moving away along road - CAMERA TRACKS after it and passes car - TRACKING FORWARD to Mountains in b.g.
M.L.S. High Angle V.W. Car moves away along road - CAMERA TILTS UP with it.  Car goes into tunnel and comes out other side.  CAMERA TRACKS after car.
L.S.  V.W. Car moves along road.  CAMERA TRACKS after it. Mountains in b.g.
L.S. High Angle V.W. Car moving away along road.  Mountain in b.g.  CAMERA TRACKS after car.
L.S. Mountain - CAMERA TRACKS IN on Hotel.
Black Frames.
Jack walks L-R across Lobby.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK & PANS with him to RECEPTIONIST behind desk.

content.line: Hi, I've got an appointment with Mr. Ullman.  My name is Jack Torrance.
His office is the first door on the left.
Thank you.

content.text: JACK moves away R-L.  CAMERA PANS with him and TRACKS IN after him through Secretary's office to open door of ULLMAN's office - revealing ULLMAN seated at desk with SECRETARY standing beside him.

content.line: Mr. Ullman?
Yes?
I'm Jack Torrance.
Oh, well - come on in Jack.

content.text: ULLMAN stands up and hands book to SECRETARY, walking round side of desk.  JACK moves into office.  CAMERA TRACKS IN after him.  He shakes hands with ULLMAN.

content.line: Very nice to meet you.
Nice to meet you, Mr. Ullman.

content.text: ULLMAN points to SECRETARY.

content.line: This is my secretary, Susie.
Hallo.
Susie, how do you do?
Have any trouble finding us?
Oh, no problem at all.  I made the trip in three and a half hours.
Well, that's very good time, very good.  Please sit down a minute.

content.text: ULLMAN points to chair cam.R.  JACK sits cam.R.f.g.  ULLMAN walks behind desk.

content.line: JAck, just make yourself at home. Would you like some coffee?
Well, if you are going to have some, I wouldn't mind.  Thanks.
Susie.
Sure.
Oh, and would you ask Bill Watson to join us?
Yes, I will.

content.text: ULLMAN sits behind desk.  SUSIE walks forward to R.f.g.
Apartment Building - cars parked in front of it.  Mountain in b.g.  CAMERA TRACKS IN on Apartment Building.

scene: INT. JACK & WENDY'S APARTMENT IN BOULDER (USA) / LIVING

content.text: ROOM - DAY - M.L.S.
DANNY is sitting at table eating a sandwich.  WENDY sitting cam.R reading book.

content.line: Mom...
Yeah.
Do you really want to go and live in that hotel for the winter?
Sure, Danny, it will be lots of fun.
Yeah, I guess so.  Anyway, there's hardly anybody to play with around here.
Yeah, I know.  It always takes a little time to make new friends.

content.text: M.S. DANNY eating sandwich.

content.line: Yeah, I guess so.
What about Tony?  He's looking forward to the hotel, I bet.

content.text: M.S. DANNY while eating sandwich wiggles forefinger of his L.hand and speaks with different voice.

content.line: NO, I ain't Mrs. Torrance.
Oh come on, Tony.  Don't be silly.

content.text: M.S. DANNY wiggles forefinger of L.hand and speaks with different voice.

content.line: I don't want to go there, Mrs. Torrance.
Well, how come you don't want to go?

content.text: M.S. DANNY wiggles forefinger of L.hand and speaks with different voice.

content.line: I just don't.
Well, let's just wait and see. We're all gonna have a real good time.

scene: INT. OVERLOOK HOTEL/ULLMAN'S OFFICE - DAY - M.L.S.

content.text: JACK over ULLMAN seated at desk.  BILL WATSON enter office. JACK rises and shakes hands with him.

content.line: Bill, I'd like you to meet Jack Torrance.
How do you do?
Bill, how do you do?
Pleased to meet you.
Pleasure to meet you.
Grab a chair Bill, and join in.

content.text: WATSON & JACK sit down.

content.line: Jack is going to take care of the Overlook for this winter.  I would like you to take him around the place as soon as we are through.
Fine.
Jack is a schoolteacher.
Eh - formerly a school-teacher.
What line of work are you in now?
I'm a writer um... Teaching has been more or less a way of making ends meet.
Well this ought to be quite a change for you.
Well, I'm looking for a change.
Our people in Denver recommended Jack very highly, and, for once, I agree with them.
Let's see, where were we?  Yes.  I was about to explain that eh... our season here runs from oh May 15th to October 30th and then we close down completely until the following May.
Do you mind if I ask why you do that?  It seems to me that the skiing up here would be fantastic.
Oh, it sure would be

but the problem is the enormous cost it would be to keep the road to the Sidewinder open.  It's a... It's a 25 mile stretch of road - gets an average of 20 feet of snow during the winter, and there's just no way to make it economically feasible to keep it clear.  When the place was built in 1907, there was very little interest in winter sports, and this site was chosen for its seclusion and scenic beauty.

content.text: M.L.S. ULLMAN over WATSON & JACK.

content.line: Well, it's certainly got plenty of that.

content.text: JACK laughs.

content.line: That's right.  And did they give you any idea in Denver about what the job entails?
Only in a very general way.
Well...

...the winters can be fantastically cruel, and the basic idea is to...to cope with the very costly damage and depreciation which can occur.  And this consists mainly of running the boiler, heating different parts of the hotel on a daily rotating basis, repairing damage as it occurs and doing repairs, so that the elements can't get a foothold.
Well, that sounds fine to me.

content.text: ULLMAN grunts off.

content.line: Physically, it's not a very demanding job.  The only thing that can get a bit trying up here during the winter is eh... the tremendous sense of isolation.
Well, that just happens to be exactly what I'm looking for.  I'm eh... I'm outlining a new writing project, and eh...
five months of peace is just what I want.
That's very good Jack, because eh... for some people eh solitude and isolation...
can of itself be a problem.
Not for me.
How about your wife and son?  How do you think they'll take to it?
They'll love it.
Great...
Well, before I turn you over to Bill, there is one other thing I think we should talk about.  I don't want to sound melodramatic, but it is something that's...
been known to give a few people second thoughts about the job.
I'm intrigued.
I don't suppose they eh told you anything in Denver about the tragedy we had up here during the winter of 1970?

content.text: M.C.S. JACK shakes his head.

content.line: I don't believe they did.
Well, my predecessor in this job

hired a man named Charles Grady, as the winter caretaker.  He came up here with his wife and two little girls of about eight or ten.  And he had a good employment record, good references and from what I've been told, I mean, he seemed like a completely normal individual.  But at some point during the winter, he must have suffered some kind of a complete mental breakdown.
He ran amok and eh... killed his family with an axe,
stacked them neatly in one of the rooms in the West Wing, and then he um... then he put eh both barrels of his shotgun in his mouth.

content.text: M.S. ULLMAN sitting behind desk.

content.line: The police eh... they thought that it was what the old-timers used to call cabin-fever, a kind of claustrophobic reaction which can occur when people are
shut in together over long periods of time.
Well, that is eh quite a story.

content.text: M.S. ULLMAN laughs.

content.line: Yes, it is.  Oh, it's still hard for me to believe that it actually happened here, but it did and eh... I think you can appreciate why I wanted to tell you about it.
Ah, I certainly can, and eh... I also understand why your people in Denver left it for you to tell me.

content.text: JACK laughs.
U.S. ULLMAN laughing.

content.line: Well, obviously some people can be
put off by the idea of staying alone in a place where something like that actually happened.

Well, you can rest assured Mr. Ullman, that's not going to happen with me, and eg as far as my wife is concerned, I am sure she'll be absolutely fascinated when I tell her about it.  She's a confirmed ghost story and horror film addict.

content.text: Shooting through open door - DANNY standing on stool at basin.

content.line: Tony, do you think Daddy will get the job?
Yeah, he did.  He's gonna phone Wendy up in a few minutes to tell her.

scene: INT. BOULDER KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM - DAY - M.S.

content.text: WENDY back to camera washing dishes at sink.  PHONE RINGS OFF.  She dries her hand and puts carton in fridge.  Then moves L-R into Living Room - CAMERA PANS with her.
She picks up telephone receiver.

content.line: (into phone) Hello.

content.text: JACK leaning on counter at reception desk, speaking into phone.

content.line: (into phone) Hi, babe.
(over phone) Hi, hon.  How's it going?
(into phone) Great.  Look, I'm at the hotel and I still have an awful lot to go through.  I don't think I can get home before nine or ten.

scene: INT. BOULDER APARTMENT/LIVING ROOM - DAY - M.S.

content.text: WENDY sitting on back of chair phone to ear.

content.line: (into phone) Sounds like you got the job?

content.text: JACK leaning on reception desk with phone to ear.

content.line: (into phone) Right it's a beautiful place.  You and Danny are gonna love it.

content.text: DANNY standing on stool by basin.  He is reflected in mirror. CAMERA TRACKS IN on his reflection in mirror.

content.line: Tony, why don't you want to go to the hotel?

content.text: DANNY wiggles forefinger.

content.line: I don't know.
You do too know, now come on tell me.

content.text: DANNY wiggles forefinger.

content.line: I don't want to.
Please...

content.text: DANNY wiggles forefinger.

content.line: No.
Now Tony, tell me.

content.text: Shooting towards doors of lifts.  Blood gushes in from L.side of lift and in from corridors L. and R. of lift doors - surging towards camera.
Two Little GRADY girls holding hands.
Blood gushing in from corridors L-R of lift doors and surging towards camera.
DANNY screaming.
Blood gushing in from corridors L-R of lift doors and surging forward.  The blood gushes up into camera lens causing black out.

content.line: Now hold your eyes still so that I can see.

scene: INT. BOULDER APARTMENT/DANNY'S BEDROOM - DAY - M.S.

content.text: DOCTOR bending over DANNY lying on top of his bed.  She is examining his eyes.  WENDY standing at foot of bed.

content.line: That's good, now the other one. Good boy.

content.text: DOCTOR straightens up.  She puts instrument away in case and closes it.  Then she sits on bed beside DANNY.

content.line: Now Danny, when you were brushing your teeth, do you remember if you smelled anything funny, or saw any bright flashing lights, or anything at all strange?
No.
Do you remember when you were brushing your teeth?
Yes.

content.text: M.S. DOCTOR sitting on bed beside DANNY.  WENDY standing at foot of bed.

content.line: What's the next thing you remember after you were brushing your teeth?
Mommy saying, 'Wake up, wake up, wake up Danny, wake up.'

content.text: M.S. DOCTOR sitting on bed beside DANNY.  WENDY standing at foot of bed.

content.line: Now Danny, can you remember what you were doing just before you started brushing your teeth?
Talking to Tony.
Is Tony one of your animals?
No.  It's the little boy that lives in my mouth.
Tony is his imaginary friend.
Oh,
if you were to open your mouth now, could I see Tony?
No.
Why not?
Because he hides.
Where does he go?
To my stomach.
Does Tony ever tell you to do things?
I don't want to talk about Tony anymore.

content.text: M.S. DOCTOR sitting on bed beside DANNY.  She pats his leg and stands up.  WENDY at foot of bed.

content.line: Okay.  That's fine.  All right Danny.

content.text: DOCTOR puts case and stethoscope in her shoulder bag.

content.line: Now I'm going to ask you to do me a favor, and stay quietly in bed for the rest of the day.  Okay?
Do I have to?
Yes, I'd like you to.
We're just going to go into one of the other rooms for a few minutes and talk - then I'll come back and check on you, okay?
Okay.
Goodbye.

content.text: WENDY & DOCTOR move R-L to open door.  DOCTOR goes into the corridor.
DOCTOR standing in corridor.  WENDY moves out of DANNY's room and closes the door.  She turns to DOCTOR.

content.line: Shall we go into the living room?
Yes.

content.text: DOCTOR & WENDY walk forward along the corridor - CAMERA TRACKS BACK before them and PANS R-L with them to Living Room.  WENDY points to sofa.

content.line: Please...
Thank you.

content.text: DOCTOR moves to sofa and sits down - WENDY sits in chair cam.R.

content.line: Mrs. Torrance, I don't think you have anything to worry about.  I'm quite sure there is nothing physically wrong with Danny.
Oh, yeah.  Oh, yeah, he seems absolutely fine now, but you should have seen him.

content.text: M.S. DOCTOR over WENDY.  DOCTOR leans back on sofa.

content.line: Oh I know.  Kids can scare you to death, but believe me these episodes are not at all uncommon, and they look much worse than they are.

content.text: M.S. WENDY over DOCTOR.

content.line: But eh what was the matter with him?
Mrs. Torrance, most of the time these episodes with kids are never explained.  They are brought on by emotional factors, and they rarely occur again.
They're more akin to auto-hypnosis, a kind of self induced trance.  If it re-occurs which I doubt

content.text: M.S. WENDY takes cigarette out of packet.

content.line: you can always think about having some tests done.

content.text: WENDY holds cigarette packet out towards DOCTOR.

content.line: No thank you.

content.text: She puts packet down on table.

content.line: Oh, I'm...I'm sure you're right.

content.text: She lights cigarette from lighter.

content.line: Have you been in Boulder long, Mrs. Torrance?
Only about three months.  Eh we're from Vermont.  My husband was teaching school there.
Did the appearance of Danny's imaginary friend...?

content.text: M.S. WENDY over DOCTOR.

content.line: Tony.
Did Tony's first appearance happen to coincide with your arrival here?
No, um let's see I guess Danny started talkin to Tony about the time we put him into nursery school.

content.text: M.S. DOCTOR over WENDY.

content.line: Did he adjust well to school?

content.text: M.C.S. WENDY - she shakes her head.

content.line: No.  He didn't like it too much at first, and then he had an injury, so we kept him out for a while, and, yeah, I...I guess that's about the time when I first noticed that he was talking to Tony.

content.text: M.S. DOCTOR over WENDY.

content.line: What sort of injury did he have?
Ah he dislocated his shoulder.

content.text: WENDY inhales.

content.line: How did he manage to do that?

Well it's just one of those things. You know... purely an accident, um. My husband had oh... been drinking, and he came home about three hours late, so he wasn't exactly in the greatest mood that night.  And well Danny had scattered some of his school papers all over the room... and my husband grabbed his arm, you know, and pulled him away from them. It's...it's just the sort of thing you do a hundred times with a child - you know, in a park or on the streets - but on this particular occasion my husband just... used too much strength and he injured Danny's arm.
Anyway, something good did come out of it all because he said:
"Wendy, I'm never gonna touch another drop and if I do you can leave me", and he didn't and he hasn't had any alcohol in eh five months.

content.text: Superimposed Title over:
High Angle Trees on side of Mountain - CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD over them to Jack's car moving away along road.
WENDY sitting beside JACK as he drives along Mountain Road. DANNY, between them, is leaning on backs of their seats. WENDY yawns.

content.line: Boy, we must be really high up. The air feels so different.
Uh...huh.
Dad?
Yes?
I'm hungry.
Well you should have eaten your breakfast.
We'll get something as soon as we get to the hotel, okay?
Okay, Mom.
Hey, wasn't it around here that the Donner party got snowbound?
I think that was farther west in the Sierras.
What was the Donner party?
There were a party of settlers in the covered wagon times.  They got snowbound one winter in the mountains.  They had to resort to cannabilism in order to stay alive.
You mean they ate each other up?
They had to, in order to survive.
Jack...
Don't worry, Mom.  I know all about cannabilism, I saw it on T.V.
See, it's okay.  He saw it all on the television.

content.text: High Angle JACK's car moving away along road on side of mountain - CAMERA TRACKS after it.
Cars parked in front of Hotel.
Man cleaning floor.  CAMERA TRACKS L-R.  WATSON & ULLMAN walk forward from b.g.

content.line: What time does the plane leave?
Eight thirty.
Well, that still gives up plenty of time to go over everything first.

content.text: Two Girls carrying luggage enter cam.R and walk away to b.g.

content.line: Goodbye Mr. Ullman.
Goodbye.

content.text: ULLMAN & WATSON walk L-R to JACK sitting in chair.

content.line: Good morning Jack.  I hope you haven't been waiting too long.
No problem.  In fact we had time to grab a bite to eat.

content.text: JACK stands up.

content.line: Good.  Glad you made it before they shut down the kitchen.  Is your family having a look around?
No, my son's discovered the games room.
Oh... Has your luggage been brought in?

content.text: JACK points to luggage.

content.line: Right there.
Oh fine.  Well in view of all the ground that we to cover today, I suggest we go and have a quick look at your apartment and then get started straight away.

content.text: ULLMAN turns to WATSON.

content.line: Bill, would you have the Torrances' things brought in their apartment.
Fine.

content.text: WATSON walks out cam.L.

content.line: I'd better collect my family first.
Oh...

content.text: ULLMAN laughs and they move out cam.L.
ULLMAN, followed by WENDY, JACK & WATSON, moves out of lift cam.R.  They walk R-L across Lounge.  CAMERA TRACKS with them.

content.line: This is our Colorado Lounge.
Oh, it's beautiful. (to Jack) My God, this place is fantastic, isn't it hon?
Sure is.
God, I've never seen anything like this before.  Are all of these Indian designs authentic?
Yes, I believe they are based mainly on Navajo and Apache motifs.
Oh well they're really gorgeous. As a matter of fact this is probably the most gorgeous hotel I've ever seen.

content.text: ULLMAN laughs.

content.line: Oh this old place has had an illustrious past.  In its heyday it was one of the stopping places for the jet set,

content.text: They reach corner and turn, walking towards camera.

content.line: even before anybody knew what a jet set was.  We've had four presidents who stayed here, lots of movie stars.
Royalty?
All the best people.

scene: INT. HOTEL GAMES ROOM - DAY - M.C.S.

content.text: DANNY throwing darts - CAMERA TRACKS BACK & PANS L-R with him as he walks to the dartboard.  He climbs up on chair and pulls two darts out.  He looks cam.L.  CAMERA ZOOMS IN on him.
M.S. Two GRADY girls, holding hands, standing near open door.
M.S.  Two GRADY girls, holding hands.  They look at one another, then turn and exit out through open doorway.

scene: INT. HOTEL/CARETAKER'S APARTMENT CORRIDOR - DAY - M.S.

content.text: ULLMAN leads WENDY & JACK forward along corridor to Caretaker's Apartment.

content.line: This is the staff wing of the hotel. None of the other bedrooms are heated during the winter.
Oh!

content.text: Two Girls carrying bags enter from cam.L.

content.line: Goodbye Mr. Ullman.
Goodbye girls.

content.text: ULLMAN waves to Girls and moves cam.R into JACK's apartment. WENDY & JACK follow him.

content.line: And here are your quarters.

content.text: ULLMAN, followed by WENDY and JACK, move up steps.  ULLMAN points to open door cam.R.

content.line: Living Room, bedroom, bathroom, and a small bedroom for your son.

content.text: JACK leans forward and looks in small bedroom cam.L.  He turns and looks cam.R. at ULLMAN.

content.line: Perfect for a child.
Yeah.
Yes.

content.text: They move into apartment.  JACK & WENDY move away through living room into bedroom - CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD after them.

content.line: Well the place is very nicely self- contained, easy to keep.

content.text: JACK feels bed.

content.line: Cosy.

content.text: JACK & WENDY move away and enter bathroom - CAMERA TRACKS after them.

content.line: Yes, very cosy for a family, and if you feel like spreading out you have the rest of the hotel to move around in.
Well, it's very... homely.
Yeah.

content.text: ULLMAN leading WENDY, JACK & WATSON R-L along outside of Maze.  CAMERA TRACKS & PANS with them.

content.line: This is our famous hedge maze. It's quite an attraction around here.  The walls are thirteen feet high and the hedges are about as old as the hotel itself.  It's a lot of fun,

content.text: They walk from end of Maze towards Hotel in b.g.

content.line: but I wouldn't go in there unless I had an hour to spare to find my way out.

content.text: Laughter.

content.line: When was the Overlook built?

content.text: M.L.S. ULLMAN leads WENDY, JACK & WATSON L-R along front of Hotel - CAMERA TRACKS with them.

content.line: Ah... construction started in 1907. It was finished in 1909.  The site is supposed to be located on an Indian burial ground, and I believe they actually had to repel a few Indian attacks as they were building it.

content.text: ULLMAN points to red Snowcat at entrance of garage.

content.line: That's our Snowcat.  Can you both drive a car?
(together) Yes.

content.text: They walk towards SNOWCAT.

content.line: That's fine because basically the Snowcat operates very much like a car and it won't take you long to get the hang of it.

content.text: ULLMAN, JACK, WATSON & WENDY walk forward along corridor - CAMERA TRACKS BACK before them.

content.line: As a matter of fact we eh... brought a decorator in from Chicago just last year to refurbish this part of the hotel.
Oh well he sure did a beautiful job. Pink and gold are my favorite colors.

content.text: ULLMAN leads WENDY, JACK & WATSON L-R into Gold Ballroom - CAMERA TRACKS with them.  Men in b.g. cleaning Ballroom.

content.line: Oh...well this is our gold ballroom.
Oh, I'll say.

content.text: ULLMAN leads them L-R across Ballroom to closed bar.

content.line: We can accommodate up to three hundred people here very comfortably.
Boy, I bet you we could really have a good party in this room, huh hon?
I'm afraid you're not going to do too well here unless you've brought your own supplies.  We always remove all the booze from the premises when we shut down:

content.text: He points to shuttered bar.

content.line: that reduces the insurance that we normally have to carry.

content.text: DICK HALLORAN walks forward from b.g.

content.line: We don't drink.

content.text: ULLMAN laughs.

content.line: Well then, you're in luck.

content.text: ULLMAN waves to HALLORAN/

content.line: Oh Dick, come on over and say hello to Mr. and Mrs. Torrance.
Sure.
This is Dick Halloran, our Head Chef.

content.text: JACK shakes hands with DICK.

content.line: Mr. Halloran, I'm Jack, and this is my wife, Winifred.
Glad to meet you, Jack.

content.text: HALLORAN shakes hands with WENDY.

content.line: Glad to meet you, Winifred.
Nice to meet you.
The Torrances are going to take care of the Overlook for us this winter.
Oh, that's just great.  How do you folks like our hotel so far?
Oh it's just wonderful.

content.text: WENDY waves out cam.L.

content.line: Hi Danny!

content.text: SUSIE holding DANNY's hand.  They walk L-R across Ballroom. CAMERA TRACKS with them to JACK, HALLORAN, WATSON, WENDY &

content.line: I found him outside looking for you.
Danny, did you get tired
of bombing the universe?
Yeah.
Danny, come on over here.

content.text: DANNY walks L-R from SUSIE to WENDY.  WENDY looks at SUSIE.

content.line: Thanks.
Thank you, Susie.

content.text: SUSIE exits cam.L.  ULLMAN turns to HALLORAN.

content.line: Dick, if you're ready to do it now, I think it would be a good idea if you could show Mrs. Torrance the kitchen, while I continue on with Jack.
It will be a pleasure.  Right this way Mrs. Torrance.
Great.  See you later, hon.

content.text: HALLORAN walks away to b.g.  WENDY & DANNY follow him.

content.line: Bye darling.

content.text: ULLMAN, JACK & WATSON move out cam.L.
WENDY holding DANNY's hand walks forward into kitchen with HALLORAN.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK before them.

content.line: Mrs. Torrance, your husband introduced you as Winifred.  Now are you a Winnie or a Freddie?
I'm a Wendy.
Oh Wendy.  That's nice.  That's the prettiest.
God.  This is the kitchen, huh?
Yeah, this is it.  How do you like it, Danny?  Is it big enough for you?
Yeah, it's the biggest place I've ever seen.

content.text: HALLORAN laughs.

content.line: Yeah.  This whole place is such an enormous maze, I feel I'll have to leave a trail of breadcrumbs every time I come in.

content.text: HALLORAN laughs.

content.line: Don't let it get you down Mrs. Torrance - it's big but it still ain't nothing but a kitchen... a lot of the stuff you'll never have to touch.
I wouldn't know what to do with it if I did.
Well one thing for sure, you don't have to worry about food because you folks could eat up here a whole year and never have the same menu twice.

content.text: HALLORAN points to cam.L and leans to cam.L taking hold of door handle.

content.line: Now right here is our walk-in freezer.

content.text: HALLORAN opens door and steps into freezer.  WENDY & DANNY stand in doorway.  HALLORAN points to various items.

content.line: Now this is where we keep all of out meat.  You got fifteen rib roasts - thirty ten pound bags of hamburgers.  You got twelve- turkeys, two dozen pork roasts and twenty legs of lamb. (to Danny) Do you like lamb, Doc?
No.
You don't?  Well what's your favorite food then?
French Fries and Ketchup.

content.text: HALLORAN laughs.

content.line: Well I think we can manage that too, Doc.  Come along now.  Watch your step.

content.text: HALLORAN points to step by door.
DANNY & WENDY, followed by HALLORAN, come out of Freezer.

content.line: Mr. Halloran,

content.text: HALLORAN closes the door and turns to WENDY.

content.line: how did you know we called him 'Doc'?

content.text: HALLORAN, DANNY & WENDY walk forward - CAMERA TRACKS BACK with them.

content.line: Beg pardon?
Doc.  You called Danny 'Doc' twice just now.
I did?
Yeah.  We call him Doc sometimes, you know, like in the Bugs Bunny cartoons.  But how did you know that?
Well I guess I probably heard you call him that.
Well, it's possible, but I honestly don't remember calling him that since we've been with you.

content.text: They all stop walking.

content.line: Well anyway, he looks like a Doc, doesn't he?

content.text: HALLORAN bends down to DANNY.

content.line: (clicks his tongue) Me ah - what's up, Doc?

content.text: HALLORAN laughs and turns away to door cam.L.  He opens door.

content.line: Now this is the storeroom.

content.text: HALLORAN moves forward into Storeroom, followed by DANNY & WENDY.  Groceries stacked on shelves.

content.line: In here, Mrs. Torrance, is where we keep all the dried goods and the canned goods.  We got canned fruits and vegetables; canned fish and meats; hot and cold cereals.

content.text: HALLORAN & WENDY move L-R - CAMERA TRACKS with them past shelf in f.g.

content.line: Post Toasties, Cornflakes, Sugar Puffs, Rice Krispies, Oatmeal, Wheatina and Cream of Wheat.

content.text: M.S. DANNY standing by cardboard boxes.  CAMERA TRACKS IN on him.

content.line: We got a dozen jugs of black molasses, we got sixty boxes of dried milk, thirty twelve pound bags of sugar.

content.text: M.S. HALLORAN talks inaudibly to WENDY, back to camera. CAMERA TRACKS IN on HALLORAN.

content.line: (thought transfer) How'd you like some ice cream, Doc?
sociables, finger rolls and seven kinds of what-have-you.

content.text: M.S. HALLORAN & WENDY move R-L to DANNY by open door. CAMERA TRACKS with them.

content.line: Now we got dried peaches, dried apricots, dried raisins and dried prunes.

content.text: HALLORAN, followed by WENDY & DANNY move out of Storeroom cam.R.f.g.

content.line: You know, Mrs. Torrance, you gotta keep regular, if you want to be happy.

content.text: HALLORAN laughs as he closes Storeroom door.  JACK, ULLMAN & WATSON walk forward from b.g.

content.line: Hi.
Hi.
How're you getting on?
Just fine.
Dick, can we borrow Mrs. Torrance for a few minutes?  We're on our way through to the basement - I promise we won't keep her very long.
No problem, Mr. Ullman.  I was just getting to the ice cream.

content.text: HALLORAN leans down to DANNY.

content.line: Do you like ice cream, Doc?
Yeah.

content.text: HALLORAN laughs.

content.line: I thought you did.

content.text: HALLORAN straightens up and looks at JACK.

content.line: You folks don't mind if I give Danny some ice cream, while we're waiting for you?
Not at all.
No, we don't mind.
Good.
Sound good to you, Danny?
Yeah.
Okay.  You behave yourself.

content.text: HALLORAN takes hold of DANNY's hand as ULLMAN, JACK, WENDY & WATSON move away to b.g.

content.line: Now what kind of ice cream do you like Doc?
Chocolate.
Chocolate it shall be.  Come on son.

content.text: HALLORAN & DANNY move out cam.L.

scene: INT. HOTEL - GREEN CORRIDOR - DAY - M.S.

content.text: ULLMAN, JACK & WENDY - followed by WATSON - move forward. CAMERA TRACKS BACK before them.

content.line: It's amazing how much activity is going on today.
Yes, well the guests and some of the staff left yesterday, but the last day is always very hectic - everybody wants to be on their way as early as possible.

content.text: They turn corner and walk away along corridor.

content.line: By five o'clock tonight, you'll never know anybody was ever here.
Just like a ghost ship, huh?
Yes.

content.text: HALLORAN looking down cam.R.

content.line: Do you know how I knew your name was Doc?

content.text: M.C.S. DANNY over HALLORAN - DANNY looking at HALLORAN.

content.line: You know what I'm talking about, don't you?

content.text: M.C.S. DANNY over HALLORAN.  DANNY looking at HALLORAN.

content.line: I can remember when I was a little boy, my grandmother and I could hold conversations entirely without ever opening our mouths.  She called it shining,
and for a long time I thought it was just the two of us that had the shine to us.
Just like you probably thought you was the only one.  But there are other folks, though mostly they don't know it, or don't believe it.
How long have you been able to do it?

content.text: M.S. HALLORAN & DANNY sitting at table.

content.line: Why don't you want to talk about it?
I'm not supposed to.
Who says you ain't supposed to?
Tony.
Who's Tony?
Tony's the little boy who lives in my mouth.
Is Tony the one that tells you things?
Yes.
How does he tell you things?

content.text: M.S. HALLORAN & DANNY sitting at table.

content.line: It's like I go to sleep, and he shows me things but when I wake up, I can't remember everything.
Does your Mum and Dad know about Tony?
Yes.
Do they know he tell you things?
Has Tony ever told you anything about this place?  About the Overlook Hotel?

content.text: M.C.S. DANNY over HALLORAN

content.line: I don't know.
Now think real hard, Doc.  Think.

content.text: M.C.S. DANNY over HALLORAN.

content.line: Maybe he showed me something.
Try to think what it was.

content.text: M.C.S. DANNY over HALLORAN.

content.line: Mr. Halloran, are you scared of this place?

content.text: M.S. Shooting across table onto HALLORAN & DANNY.

content.line: No, I'm scared of nothing here. It's just that you know some places are like people, some shine and some don't.  I guess you could say the Overlook Hotel here has something about it that's like shining.
Is there something bad here?
Well, you know Doc, when something happens it can leave a trace of itself behind... say like is someone burns toast.
Well, maybe things that happened... leave other kinds of traces behind.

Not things that anyone can notice, but things that people who shine can see.  Just like they can see things that haven't happened yet. Well, sometimes they can see things that happened a long time ago... I think a lot of things happened right here in this particular hotel - over the years, and not all of them was good.
What about Room 237?
Room 237?
You're scared of Room 237, ain'tcha?
No I ain't.
Mr. Halloran, what is in Room 237?
Nothing.  There ain't nothing in Room 237, but you ain't got no business going in there anyway, so stay out!  You understand, stay out!

content.text: Superimposition over:
Hotel.  Mountain in b.g.

scene: INT. OVERLOOK HOTEL - LOBBY - DAY - M.S.

content.text: WENDY pushing trolley forward along corridor.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK with her.  She turns to cam.L and enters Lobby.  CAMERA TRACKS R-L with her across lobby.

scene: INT. HOTEL - KITCHEN & LOUNGE - DAY - M.S.

content.text: DANNY sitting on tricycle.  He pedals out of Kitchen into Lounge, across it and back into Kitchen.
CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD after him.

scene: INT. HOTEL - CORRIDOR TO TORRANCE'S APARTMENT - DAY - M.S.

content.text: WENDY enters cam.L pushing trolley.  She pushes it forward along corridor.  CAMERA PANS L-R with her to door of their Apartment.

scene: INT. HOTEL - TORRANCE'S APARTMENT - DAY - M.C.S.

content.text: JACK asleep in bed, reflected in mirror.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK. WENDY enters cam.R carrying tray.  She walks forward. CAMERA TRACKS BACK with her.  She puts tray down on table.

content.line: Good Morning, hon.  Your breakfast is ready.
What time is it?
It's about eleven thirty.

content.text: CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD to JACK & WENDY reflected in mirror.

content.line: Eleven thirty - Jesus!
I guess we've been staying up too late.
I know it.

content.text: JACK sticks his tongue out.  WENDY picks up plate and glass of orange juice.

content.line: I made 'em just the way you like 'em, sunny side up.
Hmm, nice.

content.text: WENDY walks forward to JACK and puts plate down cam.L.  She hands him glass of orange juice and he drinks it.

content.line: It's really pretty outside.  How about taking me for a walk after you've finished your breakfast?
Oh I suppose I oughta try to do some writing first.

content.text: He puts empty glass down cam.L and picks up plate of eggs and bacon.

content.line: Any ideas yet?
Lots of ideas.  No good ones.

content.text: WENDY sits down cam.R.

content.line: Well, something'll come.  It's just a matter of settling back into the habit of writing every day.
Yeah... that's all it is.

content.text: JACK starts to eat bacon.

content.line: It's really nice up here, isn't it?
I love it.  I really do.  I've never been this happy, or comfortable anywhere.
Yeah.  It's amazing how fast you get used to such a big place.  I tell you, when we first came up here, I thought it was kinda scarey.

content.text: WENDY laughs.
M.C.S. JACK over WENDY.

content.line: I fell in love with it right away. When I came up here from my interview, it was as though I had been here before.  We...we all have moments of deja vu, but this was ridiculous.  It was almost as though I knew what was going to be around every corner.  Ooohhhhh...

content.text: WENDY laughs.
Typewriter with sheet of paper in it.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK and TILTS UP onto JACK throwing ball against wall.
M.S. JACK back to camera throwing ball against wall.
WENDY running after DANNY from Hotel to Maze - CAMERA PANS L-R & TRACKS with them to entrance to Maze.

content.line: The loser has to keep American clean, how's that?
All right.
And you're gonna lose.  And I'm gonna get you - you betta run fast! Look out - I'm coming in close. All right?

content.text: DANNY & WENDY run into Maze.  CAMERA TRACKS L-R onto plan of Maze on board.

content.line: You'll have to keep America clean.

content.text: DANNY & WENDY walking forward in Maze - CAMERA TRACKS BACK before them.

content.line: Okay Danny, you win.  Let's take the rest of this walking, huh?
Okay...oh!
Give me your hand.  Oh, isn't it beautiful.
Yeah.

content.text: M.S. WENDY & DANNY backs to camera walking away through Maze - CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD after them.

content.line: Here's a dead end.

content.text: WENDY & DANNY turn at dead end and walk away along Maze. CAMERA TRACKS after them.

JACK back to camera bounces ball on floor and catches it. Then he throws it away to b.g.  He walks away to model of Maze on table by window.  CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD after him. He stops by model and leans on table.
M.S. Shooting over model of Maze on table to JACK looking down at it.
M.C.S. JACK looking down.
High Angle shooting down on Maze.  WENDY & DANNY move through it.  CAMERA TRACKS DOWN on Maze.

content.line: Oh what a Maze.  Isn't it beautiful.
Yeah.

content.text: M.S. DANNY & WENDY walk forward through Maze - CAMERA TRACKS BACK before them.

content.line: It's so pretty.
Yeah.
I didn't think it was going to be this big, did you?
No.

content.text: Superimposition over:
Hotel.  Mountain in b.g.
WENDY's hands taking lid of can.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK to table with portable T.V. Set on it.  The set is switched on.

content.line: Rutherford was serving a life sentence for his conviction in the 1968 shooting and the search continues in the mountains near Uray today for that missing Aspen woman,

content.text: WENDY carries tin to bowl on table.

content.line: twenty-four year old Susan Robertson has been missing ten days.  She disappeared while on a hunting trip with her husband.  They have good weather right now, but they may have to call off the search if the predicted snowstorm moves in tomorrow.

content.text: Picture on T.V. Set changes to MAN & WOMAN.

content.line: But it's so beautiful here in Denver today, it's hard to believe a snowstorm could be that close.
I know.  I want to go outside and lie in the sun.  Yet to our north, to our west, it is snowing and cold, and it's moving
right here towards Colorado, right now as we talk.  It's incredible.
I know.

content.text: DANNY back to camera on tricycle pedals away along corridors - CAMERA TRACKS after him.  He looks at door cam.L and slows down, stopping.
M.S. DANNY in f.g.  Number 237 on door in b.g.
M.C.S. DANNY looking at number.
M.S. DANNY in f.g.  Number 237 on door in b.g.
M.L.S. Corridor.  DANNY in f.g. gets off tricycle, and moves R-L to door of room 237.  He looks up at number - then reaches out to door handle and turns it.  Door doesn't open. He looks up at number.
M.S. Two GRADY Girls holding hands.
M.S. DANNY looking up at number on door.  He moves L-R to his tricycle.  CAMERA PANS with him.  He sits on tricycle and pedals fast away along corridor.
Lounge.  JACK sitting back to camera typing at table. CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD onto him.
M.C.S. JACK typing.
M.L.S. JACK back to camera typing at table in f.g.  WENDY enters cam.R.b.g. and walks forward to JACK.

content.line: Hi, hon.  How's it going?

content.text: WENDY stops cam.R of him.  JACK pulls page from typewriter.

content.line: Fine.

content.text: WENDY kisses him.

content.line: Get a lot written today?

content.text: M.S. JACK looking up cam.L at WENDY.

content.line: Yes.
Hey, the weather forecast said it's going to snow tonight.

content.text: M.S. JACK looking up cam.L at WENDY.

content.line: What do you want me to do about it?
Ah, come on hon.  Don't be so grouchy.

content.text: M.S. JACK looking up cam.L at WENDY.

content.line: I'm not being grouchy.  I just want to finish my work.
Okay.  I understand.  I'll come back later on with a couple of sandwiches for you and... maybe you'll let me read something then.
Wendy, (clears throat) let me explain something to you. Whenever you come in here and interrupt me, you're breaking my concentration.

content.text: JACK hits his forehead with his hand.

content.line: you're distracting me,

content.text: He picks up sheet of paper and tears it up.  Then he throws the pieces down.

content.line: and it will then take me time to get back to where I was, understand?
Yes.
Fine.  Now we're going to make a new rule.  Whenever I am in here and you hear me typing,

content.text: JACK taps typewriter keys.

content.line: or whether you don't hear me typing, whatever the fuck you hear me doing in here, when I am in here that means that I am working - that means don't come in.  Now do you think you can handle that?
Yes.
Fine.  Why don't you start right now and get the fuck out of here, hmm?
Okay.

content.text: M.L.S. WENDY standing cam.R of JACK back to camera sitting at table.  She turns and walks away to b.g.  CAMERA TRACKS
M.S. JACK starts to type.
Black Frames.
Superimposition over:
WENDY running R-L being chased by DANNY carrying snowballs. AD LIB SHOUTS & LAUGHTER.  CAMERA TRACKS R-L with them past Hotel in b.g.

content.line: I know you've got some.

content.text: JACK at window watching WENDY & DANNY playing in the snow. CAMERA TRACKS IN to M.C.S.
Superimposition over:
HOTEL in b.g.  Trees and snow in f.g.
High Angle JACK sitting at table in b.g. typing.

scene: INT. HOTEL - LOBBY & OFFICE - DAY - M.S.

content.text: WENDY standing at switchboard with headset on her L.ear and putting plugs into switchboard.

content.line: Oh no!

content.text: WENDY puts socket into various plugs.

content.line: I knew it!

content.text: WENDY puts headset and plug down and turns away from switchboard.  She walks R-L to door.

M.L.S. WENDY walks out of switchboard - round counter and moves forward R-L across Lobby.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK before her.  She moves R-L into Office.  CAMERA PANS with her.  She stops at radio set and switches it on.  She pulls microphone towards her.

content.line: (into mike) This is KDK 12 calling KDK 1.

content.text: RANGER seated at radio cam.L.  MAN standing at filing cabinet cam.R.  GIRL seated at desk cam.R.

content.line: (over radio) KDK 12 to KDK 1.
(into mike) This is KDK 1.  We're receiving you. Over.

content.text: WENDY picks up microphone.

content.line: (into mike) Hi.  This is Wendy Torrance at the Overlook Hotel.

content.text: RANGER seated at radio speaking into mike.

content.line: (into mike) Hi.  How are you folks getting on up there?  Over.

content.text: WENDY, holding mike, seated on cabinet with foot up on desk.

content.line: (into mike) Oh we're just fine, but our telephones don't seem to be doing too well.  Are the lines down by any chance?  Over.

content.text: RANGER seated at radio, speaking into mike.

content.line: (into mike) Yes.  Quite a few of them are down, due to the storm.  Over.
(over radio) Any chance of them being repaired soon?  Over.
(into mike) Well, I wouldn't like to say.  Most winters they stay that way until spring.  Over.

content.text: WENDY, holding mike, seated on cabinet with foot up on desk.

content.line: (into mike) Boy, this storm is really something, isn't it?  Over.

content.text: RANGER sitting at radio - speaking into mike.

content.line: (into mike) Oh yes.  It's one of the worst we've had for years.  Is there anything else we can do for you, Mrs. Torrance?  Over.

content.text: WENDY holding mike seated on cabinet with foot up on desk.

content.line: (into mike) I suppose not.  Over.

content.text: RANGER seated at radio - speaking into mike.

content.line: (into mike) Well, if you folks have any problems up there just give us a call, and Mrs. Torrance.

content.text: WENDY holding mike - seated on cabinet with one foot up on desk.

content.line: (over radio) I think it might be a good idea if you leave your radio on all the time now.  Over.
(into mike) Okay.  We'll do that.  It was real nice talking to you.  Bye.  Over and Out.

content.text: WENDY puts down mike.
DANNY pedals away along corridor on his tricycle.  CAMERA TRACKS after him.  He exits cam.R at the end of corridor. CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD along empty corridor.
DANNY pedals away along corridor.  CAMERA TRACKS after him. He turns corner and stops as he sees the two GRADY Girls at the end.
M.L.S. DANNY back to camera in f.g.  The two GRADY Girls at end of corridor.

content.line: Hullo, Danny.
Come and play with us.

content.text: M.L.S. DANNY back to camera in f.g.  The two GRADY Girls at end of corridor.

content.line: Come and play with us, Danny.

content.text: M.S. The two GRADY Girls laying on floor covered with bloodstains.  Bloodstained axe on floor in f.g.  Walls covered with bloodstains.
M.L.S. Two GRADY Girls, holding hands and standing at end of corridor.

content.line: For ever...

content.text: M.S. The two GRADY Girls lying on floor, covered with bloodstains.  Bloodstained axe on floor in f.g.  Wall covered with bloodstains.
M.C.S. DANNY reacts.
M.S. Two GRADY Girls holding hands and standing at end of corridor.

content.line: ... and ever...

content.text: M.S. The two GRADY Girls lying on floor covered with bloodstains.  Bloodstained axe on floor in f.g.  Wall covered with bloodstains.
M.S. Two GRADY Girls holding hands standing at end of corridor.

content.line: ...and ever.

content.text: M.S. Two GRADY Girls lying on floor covered with bloodstains. Bloodstained axe on floor in f.g.
Wall covered with bloodstains.
M.C.S. DANNY reacts.  He puts hands over his eyes.  Then he opens his fingers and looks through them.
M.S. DANNY's P.O.V.  Empty corridor.
M.C.S. DANNY looking through his open fingers.  He lowers his hands from his face.
M.L.S. DANNY back to camera in f.g. in empty corridor.

content.line: Tony, I'm scared.

content.text: He raises up his R.hand and wiggles his forefinger as he speaks.

content.line: Remember what Mr. Halloran said. It's just like pictures in a book, Danny.  It isn't real.

content.text: Superimposition over:

scene: INT. OVERLOOK HOTEL - LOBBY - DAY - M.S.

content.text: Play on Television set, CAMERA TRACKS BACK from set to reveal WENDY, seated on sofa cam.L, watching set, DANNY seated on floor watching set also cam.R.

content.line: (on T.V.) Please let me give you some money.
(on T.V.) Oh I wouldn't think of it.
(on T.V.) Well how can I repay you?
(on T.V.) It's okay, really.
(on T.V.) Well I'm going to have some coffee. Would you like some?
(on T.V.) Sure.
(on T.V.) Great.  Sit down.  Oh these marvellous doughnuts, help yourself. Coffee will be ready in a few minutes.

content.text: Play on Television continues inaudibly in b.g.

content.line: Mom?
Yes?
Can I go to my room and get my fire-engine?
Not right now, Daddy's asleep.
I won't make any noise.
Come on, Doc.  He only went to bed a few hours ago.  Can't you wait till later?
I won't make a sound, I promise. I'll tip-toe.
Well all right.  But really don't make a sound.
I won't, Mom.

content.text: DANNY stands up and runs out cam.L.

content.line: Make sure you come right back, 'cause I'm going to make lunch soon. Okay?
Okay, Mom.

scene: INT. HOTEL - JACK'S APARTMENT - DAY - M.C.S.

content.text: Door opens and DANNY appears.  He enters room - CAMERA TRACKS BACK with him as he walks forward up steps.  He looks to cam.R.  CAMERA PANS L-R to JACK sitting on edge of bed. JACK looks towards camera.
M.L.S. JACK seated on bed cam.R.f.g.  DANNY standing at open door in b.g.

content.line: Can I go to my room and get my fire-engine?
Come here for a minute, first.

content.text: JACK holds out his hand to DANNY, who walks forward.
M.S. JACK sitting on bed.  DANNY enters cam.L.f.g. and stops cam.R of JACK.  JACK sits DANNY on his knee and puts his arms round him, kissing him.

content.line: How's it going, Doc?
Okay.

content.text: M.S. JACK over DANNY seated on his knee.

content.line: Are you having a good time?
Yes, Dad.
Good.  I want you to have a good time.
I am, Dad.  Dad?
Yes.
Do you feel bad?

content.text: JACK shakes his head.

content.line: No.  I'm just a little tired.
Then why don't you go to sleep?
I can't.  I have too much to do.
Dad?
Yes?
Do you like this hotel?

content.text: JACK smiles and looks at DANNY.

content.line: Yes I do.  I love it.  Don't you?
I guess so.
Good.  I want you to like it here. I wish we could stay here for ever, and ever... ever.
Dad?
What?
You wouldn't ever hurt Mummy and me, would you?
What do you mean?

content.text: M.S. DANNY over JACK.

content.line: Did your mother ever say that to you - that I would hurt you?
No, Dad.
Are you sure?
Yes, Dad.

content.text: M.S. JACK over DANNY.

content.line: I love you, Danny.  I love you more than anything else in the whole world, and I'd never do anything to hurt you, never... You know that, don't you, huh?
Yes, Dad.
Good.

content.text: Superimposition over:
Shooting across snow to Hotel in b.g.  Three lit windows.

scene: INT. HOTEL - CORRIDOR TO ROOM 237 - M.C.S.

content.text: High Angle - DANNY playing on floor with toy cars and trucks. CAMERA TRACKS UP & BACK - yellow ball rolls in from f.g. and stops by one of DANNY's trucks.  DANNY looks up.
M.L.S. DANNY, back to camera, in f.g. looking away along empty corridor.
M.S. DANNY kneeling on the floor by his toys.  He stands up.

content.line: Mom?

content.text: M.L.S. DANNY, back to camera, in f.g.  Empty corridor in b.g.
M.S. DANNY walks forward along corridor - CAMERA TRACKS BACK with him.

content.line: Mom?

content.text: M.L.S. Empty corridor.  CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD to open door of Room 237.

content.line: Mom, are you in there?

content.text: CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD into room.

WENDY, holding clipboard.  She looks at dials on boiler - then moves R-L to second boiler.  CAMERA PANS with her.  She looks at dials - then moves R-L to switchboard and presses two switches.  She reacts as she hears JACK off groaning in his sleep.  She puts down clipboard and moves L-R.  CAMERA PANS with her.  She starts to run away to entrance.
JACK leaning forward in chair with head resting on table. He groans and cries out as he sleeps.  CAMERA TRACKS IN on them.

scene: INT. HOTEL - CORRIDOR TO LOUNGE - M.S.

content.text: WENDY running away along corridor - CAMERA TRACKS after her.

content.line: Jack...

content.text: WENDY turns corner to entrance to Lounge.

content.line: Jack... Jack...

content.text: WENDY runs forward into Lounge and goes to JACK asleep at table.  CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD.

content.line: Jack, honey, what's wrong?

content.text: She puts her hands on his arm and back.  JACK stirs and falls off chair onto floor.
M.S. JACK groans as he lies on floor.  WENDY enters cam.R and takes hold of his arm, assisting up onto his knees.  He groans and gasps.

content.line: What happened, honey?  Hon?  What's wrong?  Jack!

content.text: She smoothes his hair with her hand.

content.line: I had... I had the most terrible nightmare I ever had.  It's the most horrible dream I ever had.
It's okay.  It's okay, now.  Really.
I dreamed that I... that I killed you and Danny.

content.text: M.S. JACK over WENDY.

content.line: But I didn't just kill you, I cut you up into little pieces.

content.text: He puts his hand up to his eyes.

content.line: Oh...

content.text: M.S. JACK handed up to his eyes - and WENDY.

content.line: My God, I must be losing my mind!

content.text: He lowers his hand.

content.line: Every...everything is just going to be all right.  Come on.  Here let's get up off the floor.

content.text: WENDY puts hand under his arm and he starts to rise.
DANNY back to camera in f.g. walks into Lounge.  In b.g. WENDY helps JACK up into his chair.  INAUDIBLE DIALOGUE. WENDY turns to DANNY and throws up her arm.  CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD with DANNY.

content.line: Danny!  Everything's okay... Just go play in your room for a while. Your Dad's just got a headache. Danny - mind what I say.  Go play in your room!

content.text: WENDY bends down to JACK.

content.line: Hon, let me just go and get him out of here.  I'll be right back.

content.text: WENDY moves R-L behind table and moves forward to DANNY in f.g.

content.line: Danny, why don't you mind me - huh? Danny.

content.text: She crouches down before DANNY and turns him cam.L to face her, and the window.  He is sucking his thumb.  She sees mark on his neck and tilts his head over sideways.

content.line: Oh my God!  Danny what happened to your neck?  Danny...

content.text: She pulls DANNY's thumb out of his mouth.

content.line: what happened to your neck, huh?

content.text: She puts her arms round him.
M.L.S. JACK, back to camera, leaning back in chair in f.g. WENDY kneeling with her arms round DANNY in b.g.
M.C.S. JACK sitting in chair with his hand up to his head.
M.L.S. JACK back to camera leaning back in chair in f.g. WENDY kneeling with her arms round DANNY in b.g.  She stands up and lifts DANNY up in her arms.
M.S. WENDY holding DANNY in her arms.

content.line: You did this to him, didn't you?
You son of a bitch!  You did this to him,

content.text: He shakes his head.

content.line: didn't you?

content.text: He shakes his head.
M.S. WENDY with DANNY in her arms moves backwards.

content.line: How could you?  How could you?

content.text: She turns and runs away to entrance in b.g.
M.C.S. JACK.  He lowers his hand.

JACK enters cam.L in b.g. and walks forward.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK before him.  He mutters and flings his arms about.  He stops and looks at notice on trestle - "THE GOLD ROOM." JACK moves L-R into entrance of Ballroom.  He reaches out cam.L and switches on lights - then moves away to lit bar in b.g.
JACK walks L-R across Ballroom - CAMERA TRACKS & PANS with him to bar.
M.L.S. JACK leans over counter and looks down.

content.line: (to himself) God, I'd give anything for a drink?

content.text: JACK sits down and puts his hands up to his face.

content.line: My goddam soul, just a glass of beer.

content.text: M.S. JACK with his hands up to his face.  He lowers his hands and looks - he lowers hands to bar and smiles.

content.line: Hi Lloyd.

content.text: JACK looks cam.R then back at camera.

content.line: A little slow tonight, isn't it?

content.text: JACK laughs.
M.S. LLOYD standing behind bar.

content.line: Yes, it is, Mr. Torrance.

content.text: LLOYD moves forward - CAMERA TRACKS BACK revealing JACK seated at bar.

content.line: What'll it be?

Now I'm awfully glad you asked me that, Lloyd, because I just happen to have two twenties and two tens right here in my wallet.  I was afraid they were going to be there until next April.  So here's what: you slip me a bottle of Bourbon, a glass and some ice.  You can do that, can't you, Lloyd?  You're not to busy, are you?
No, sir.  I'm not busy at all.

content.text: LLOYD turns away to bottles of shelf.

content.line: Good man.

content.text: LLOYD turns with bottle and glass to counter.

content.line: You set them up, and I'll knock them back, Lloyd, one by one.

content.text: M.S. JACK sitting at bar.  LLOYD puts bottle and glass down on bar.  LLOYD puts ice in glass and fills it from bottle.

content.line: White man's burden, Lloyd my man. White man's burden.

content.text: JACK looks at his wallet then at LLOYD.

content.line: Say, Lloyd, it seems I'm temporarily light.

content.text: JACK laughs.

content.line: How's my credit in this joint anyway?
Your credit's fine, Mr. Torrance.
That's swell.  I like you, Lloyd. I always liked you.  You were always the best of them.
Best goddamned bartender from Timbuctoo to Portland Maine - Portland Oregon for that matter.
Thank you for saying so.

content.text: M.C.S. JACK looks at his glass.

content.line: Here's to five miserable months on the wagon and all the irreparable harm that it's caused me.

content.text: He drinks and lowers his glass - then looks at LLOYD.
M.S. JACK sitting at bar.  LLOYD behind bar.

content.line: How are things going, Mr. Torrance?
Things could be better, Lloyd. Things could be a whole lot better.
I hope it's nothing serious.

content.text: JACK taps on bar and LLOYD fills up his glass.

content.line: No, nothing serious.
Just a little problem with the... old sperm bank upstairs.

content.text: JACK laughs.

content.line: Nothing that I can't handle though, Lloyd.  Thanks.
Women!  Can't live with 'em.  Can't live without 'em!

content.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD.  He points finger at LLOYD.

content.line: Words of wisdom, Lloyd.  Words of wisdom.

content.text: JACK drinks - then swirls drink round in glass, putting glass down on counter.

content.line: I haven't laid a hand on him. Goddam it, I didn't.  I wouldn't touch one hair of his goddam little head.  I love the little son-of-a- bitch.

content.text: JACK laughs.

content.line: I'd do anything for him.  Any fucking thing for him.
That damn bitch.
As long as I live she'll never let me forget what happened!

content.text: He looks cam.L then cam.R -- throwing his hands out and sighing.

content.line: I did hurt him once, okay?  It was an accident, complete unintentional. It could have happened to anybody.

content.text: He raps on counter with hand.

content.line: And it was three goddam years ago. The little fucker had thrown all my papers all over the floor.  All I tried to do was to pull him up.  A momentary loss of muscular coordination.  I mean... A few extra foot pounds of energy, per second... per second.

content.text: JACK gestures with his hands.

content.line: Jack...

content.text: WENDY, sobbing, runs forward along corridor.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK with her and PANS L-R into Ballroom.  She runs away to JACK sitting at bat in b.g.

content.line: Oh Jack! (sobs) Thank God you're here.

content.text: JACK sitting back to camera at bar.  WENDY enters cam.R.

content.line: Jack,
Jack, there's someone else in the hotel with us.  There's a crazy woman in one of the rooms.  She tried to strangle Danny.
Are you out of your fucking mind?

content.text: M.S. WENDY over JACK.

content.line: No.  It's the truth, really.  I swear it.  Danny told me.  He went up into one of the bedrooms, the door was open, and he saw this crazy woman in the bath-tub.  She tried to strangle him.
Which room was it?

content.text: Montage of shots on T.V. Set for program "NEWSWATCH."

content.line: (on T.V.) From Channel 10 in Miami, this is Newswatch - with Glen Rinker and Bishop, and the award winning Newswatch team.

content.text: CAMERA TRACKS BACK to reveal T.V. Set.  HALLORAN's bare feet and legs on bed in f.g.  Shot of GLEN RINKER on T.V. Set with superimposed title:
'10 GLEN RINKER WPLG MIAMI'

content.line: (on T.V.) Good evening.  I'm Glen Rinker Newswatch 10.  While Miami continues to swelter in a record winter heatwave bringing temperatures to the mid and upper nineties, the Central and Rocky Mountain States are buried in snow.
In Colorado ten inches of snow has fallen in just a few hours tonight. Travel in the Rockies is almost impossible.

content.text: M.C.S. HALLORAN - CAMERA TRACKS BACK to reveal him lying on bed, watching T.V.

content.line: (on T.V.) Airports are shut down stranding thousands of passengers.  Highways are blocked by snowdrifts.  Railroad tracks are frozen.  Officials in Colorado tell Newswatch at least three people have been killed by exposure to freezing winds.  The Governor of Colorado is expected tomorrow to declare a weather emergency.  The National Guard might be called out to clear streets and roads.  Weather forecasters predict more snow and heavy winds tonight and tomorrow, with temperatures dropping well below zero.

content.text: M.S. HALLORAN's feet and legs on beg in f.g.  GLEN RINKER on T.V. Set at foot of bed.

content.line: (on T.V.) Back here in South Florida, we've got just the opposite problem; the heat and humidity are supposed to climb.

content.text: M.S. HALLORAN lying on pillows.  CAMERA TRACKS IN to C.S. his face, as he reacts.

content.line: (on T.V.) Local beaches should be jammed. Our weather expert Walter Cronice will have the local forecast later on.

content.text: COMMENTATOR continues inaudibly in b.g.
Open door of Room 237.
DANNY, his head shaking.

Mantlepiece and fireplace.  CAMERA PANS R-L across room to open door.  Then TRACKS FORWARD through doorway to slightly open door of bathroom.  CAMERA STOPS TRACKING.  Door swings open to reveal YOUNG LADY seated in bath behind curtain.
M.S. YOUNG LADY seated in bath behind curtain.  She draws curtain aside with hand.
M.C.S. JACK - he smiles.
M.S. YOUNG LADY stands up in bath.
M.S. YOUNG LADY steps out of bath.
M.C.S. JACK - he smiles.
M.S. YOUNG LADY walks forward from bath and stops in f.g.
M.C.S. JACK - he moves forward.
M.S. JACK moves forward to YOUNG LADY - she puts her arms round his neck.  He puts his arms round her and they kiss.

M.C.S. JACK over YOUNG LADY as they kiss.  He opens his eyes and reacts.  He pulls back from YOUNG LADY - CAMERA PANS L-R onto mirror.  JACK & WOMAN reflected in it.  He sees that she is covered with scars.  He takes his arms away from her - she starts to laugh.
DANNY - he is shaking his head.  WOMAN LAUGHING OFF.
ELDERLY WOMAN lying in water in bath.  WOMAN LAUGHING OFF.
M.S. JACK shaking his head as he backs out of bathroom.
M.S. Naked ELDERLY WOMAN laughing as she walks forward with outstretched arms.
DANNY shaking his head.  WOMAN LAUGHING OFF.
Naked ELDERLY WOMAN lying in water in bath.  WOMAN LAUGHING
M.S. JACK backs down steps into living room - WOMAN LAUGHING
M.S. Naked ELDERLY WOMAN laughing, as she walks forward with outstretched arms.
DANNY shaking his head.  WOMAN LAUGHING OFF.
Naked ELDERLY WOMAN lying in water in bath.  She starts to sit up.  WOMAN LAUGHING OFF.
JACK backs out of Room 237 into corridor.  He closes the door and locks it - then backs away along corridor.  He exits cam.L.  WOMAN LAUGHING OFF.
HALLORAN telephone up to ear.  He dials number, then picks up phone and walks R-L to window.  He turns and walks back L-R.  He puts phone down.

content.line: (over phone) We are sorry your call cannot be completed as dialed.  If you need assistance, please call the operator.

content.text: He puts telephone down.
WENDY moves R-L in b.g. sobbing.  KNOCK ON DOOR OFF.  She reacts and runs forward.

content.line: Jack?
Yes, it's me.

content.text: She moves R-L.  CAMERA PANS with her down steps to front door.  CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD after her.

content.line: Oh, thank God!

content.text: WENDY takes chain off door and opens it.  JACK enters apartment.

content.line: Did you find anything?
No, nothing at all.

content.text: JACK closes front door.

content.line: I didn't see one goddam thing.

content.text: JACK & WENDY walks forward and move up steps to DANNY's bedroom.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK before them.

content.line: You went into the room Danny said - to 237?
Yes, I did.
And you didn't see anything at all?
Absolutely nothing.  How is he?

content.text: JACK moves R-L and looks into darkened bedroom.

content.line: He's still asleep.
Good.

content.text: JACK closes bedroom door and turns to WENDY.

content.line: I'm sure he'll be himself again in the morning.

content.text: They move L-R into Living Room.  CAMERA PANS with them and TRACKS after them across room.

content.line: Well, are you sure it was the right room?  I mean, maybe Danny made a mistake?

content.text: WENDY & JACK move into their bedroom.

content.line: He must have gone into that room - the door was open and the lights were on.

content.text: WENDY sits on bed.

content.line: Oh, I just don't understand.

content.text: JACK sits down on bed beside her.
M.C.S. WENDY sobbing.

content.line: Well what about those bruises on his neck?

content.text: M.C.S. JACK over WENDY.

content.line: Somebody did that to him.
I think he did it to himself.

content.text: M.C.S. WENDY shakes her head.

content.line: No!  No, that's not possible.

content.text: M.C.S. JACK over WENDY.

content.line: Wendy, once you rule out his version of what happened, there is no other explanation - is there? It wouldn't be that different from the episode that he had before we came up here, would it?

scene: INT. OVERLOOK HOTEL - DANNY'S BEDROOM - M.S.

content.text: DANNY lying awake on his bed.  CAMERA TRACKS IN on him.

content.line: Jack, whatever the explanation is,

content.text: M.S. Low Angle Door with word "MURDER" written backwards across it.
M.C.S. DANNY lying awake on his bed.  CAMERA TRACKS IN on him.

content.line: I think we have to get Danny out of here.

content.text: JACK over WENDY.

content.line: Get him out of here?
Yes.
You mean just leave the hotel?
Yes.

content.text: DANNY with his mouth wide open.
Blood gushing forward from lifts and surging up into camera lens.
JACK over WENDY.

content.line: It is so fucking typical of you to create a problem like this when I finally have a chance to accomplish something.  When I'm really into my work.  I could really write my own ticket if I went back to Boulder now, couldn't I?

content.text: M.S. WENDY & JACK sitting on bed - JACK stands up and turns to her.

content.line: Shovellings out driveways, work in a car wash - any of that appeal to you?
Jack...
Wendy, I have let you fuck up my life so far, but I'm not going to let you fuck this up!

content.text: He starts to move away.

M.L.S. JACK walks forward from WENDY, sitting on bed.  He crosses living room and CAMERA PANS R-L with him to steps leading to front door.  He walks away down steps, opens front door and walks away along corridor.
M.S. WENDY sitting on bed, starts to cry.  She leans forward and buries her face in her hands.

JACK moves forward in kitchen.  He sweeps coffee pot off table onto floor.  CAMERA TRACKS BACK before him.  He kicks coffee pots on floor, then sweeps rings off stove onto floor. He kicks rings as he leaves kitchen, moving into corridor. CAMERA TRACKS BACK before him.  He stops and looks ahead.

scene: INT. HOTEL CORRIDOR LEADING TO BALLROOM - M.L.S.

content.text: Empty corridor.  Balloons and streamers strewn about.

scene: INT. MIAMI - HALLORAN'S APARTMENT - NIGHT - M.S.

content.text: HALLORAN standing, phone up to ear.

content.line: (over phone) Good evening.  Forest Service.
(into phone) Hallo.  My name's Dick Halloran. I'm the Head Chef up at the Overlook Hotel.
(over phone) Good evening, Mr. Halloran.  What can I do for you?
(into phone) Sir, I've been trying to make an urgent phone call up there,

content.text: He picks up phone and walks R-L to window.  CAMERA PANS with him.

content.line: (into phone) but the operator said that the phone lines are down.

content.text: RANGER sitting at radio with phone to ear.

content.line: (into phone) Yes, I'm afraid a lot of lines around here are down, due to the storm.

content.text: HALLORAN, phone to ear, at window.

content.line: (into phone) Well, look sir, I hate to put you to any trouble, but there's a family up there all by themselves with a young kid, and with this storm and everything.

content.text: HALLORAN moves L-R.  CAMERA TRACKS with him.  He puts phone on table.

content.line: (into phone) I'd sure appreciate it if you'd give them a call on your radio just to see if everything is okay.

content.text: RANGER sitting at radio, phone to ear.

content.line: (into phone) I'd be glad to do that, sir.  Oh why don't you call me back in about eh twenty minutes?
(over phone) Thank you very much.  I'll do that.
(into phone) All right, sir.

content.text: RANGER puts phone down.
JACK walks forward along corridor to Ballroom.  He turns L-R into Ballroom - CAMERA TRACKS with him revealing crowded Ballroom.  MAITRE D standing at entrance.

content.line: Good evening, Mr. Torrance.
Good evening.

content.text: JACK moves L-R across crowded Ballroom - CAMERA TRACKS with him to LLOYD serving behind bar.  JACK sits at bar.  LLOYD moves to him.

content.line: Hi Lloyd.  I've been away.  Now I'm back.
Good evening Mr. Torrance.

content.text: LLOYD puts dishes of olives and peanuts on bar before JACK.
M.S. JACK over LLOYD.

content.line: It's good to see you.
It's good to be back, Lloyd.
What'll it be, sir?

content.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD

content.line: Hair of the dog that big me.
Bourbon on the rocks.

content.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD

content.line: That'll do her.

content.text: JACK takes handful of peanuts and empties them into his mouth.  LLOYD puts ice into glass.
M.C.S. LLOYD preparing drink.
M.S. JACK over LLOYD.  LLOYD pouring drink.  JACK takes out his wallet, takes out note and holds it out to LLOYD.  LLOYD holds up his hand.

content.line: No charge to you, Mr. Torrance.

content.text: JACK looks down at note and up to LLOYD.

content.line: No charge?
Your money's no good here.

content.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD.  JACK looks down at his note then up at LLOYD.

content.line: Orders from the house.

content.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD.  JACK puts note back into his wallet.

content.line: Orders from the house.

content.text: He puts wallet away.

content.line: Drink up, Mr. Torrance.

content.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD.  JACK tucking wallet into his hip pocket.

content.line: I'm the kind of man likes to know who's buying their drinks, Lloyd.
It's not a matter that concerns you, Mr. Torrance - at least not at this point.

content.text: M.S. JACK over LLOYD.  JACK smiles and picks up his drinks.

content.line: Anything you say, Lloyd.  Anything you say.

content.text: JACK turns away from bar.

M.L.S. JACK moves away from bar.  He dances forward to center of room - CAMERA TRACKS after him.  WOMAN enters cam.R.f.g. and walks away.  WAITER (GRADY), carrying tray of drinks, walks forward from b.g.  He bumps into WOMAN.

content.line: Oh!

content.text: GRADY staggers forward, colliding with JACK and spilling drinks down front of JACK's jacket.

content.line: Oh dear, oh dear.  I'm so sorry, sir.  Oh!

content.text: He puts down tray and takes advocaat glass from JACK.

content.line: Oh dear oh dear... I've made an awful mess of your jacket, sir.

content.text: GRADY puts glass on tray.

content.line: Oh eh that's all right.  I've got plenty of jackets.

content.text: GRADY mops JACK's jacket with his serviette.

content.line: I'm afraid it's advocaat sir.  It tends to stain.
Advocaat is it?
Yes sir.  Look um... I think the best thing is to come along to the gentlemen's room, sir, and eh...

content.text: GRADY bends down and picks up his tray.

content.line: we'll get some water to it, sir.

content.text: JACK & GRADY start to walk away to the Gentlemen's.  CAMERA TRACKS after them.

content.line: Looks as though you might have got a spot of it on yourself there, Jeevesy old boy.

content.text: JACK pats GRADY on his back.

content.line: That doesn't matter, sir.  You're the important one.
Awfully nice of you to say.  Of course I intend to change my jacket this evening before the fish and goose soiree.

content.text: JACK & GRADY enter Gentlemen's Toilet.

content.line: Very wise, sir.  Very wise.

content.text: JACK exits cam.R behind door.

content.line: Here, I'll just, eh...

content.text: Men's toilet.  JACK moves in from cam.L.b.g.  He holds door open.

content.line: hold this for you there, Jeevesy.

content.text: GRADY enters cam.L.

content.line: Thank you, sir.  Thank you.

content.text: GRADY walks forward and puts his tray down on basins cam.R. JACK walks forward.

content.line: Now let's see if we can improve this with a little water, sir.

content.text: GRADY soaks his serviette under tap.  JACK puts glass down cam.L and turns to GRADY cam.R.

content.line: Right, I'll just set my bourbon and advocaat down right there.

content.text: JACK laughs.  GRADY starts to sponge JACK with serviette.

content.line: Won't keep you a moment, sir.
Fine.

content.text: GRADY sponges JACK.

content.line: What do they call you around here, Jeevesy?
Grady, sir.  Delbert Grady.

content.text: M.S. JACK over GRADY.  GRADY sponging JACK's jacket.

content.line: Grady?
Yes, sir.
Delbert Grady.
That's right, sir.

content.text: GRADY sponges JACK's trousers.

content.line: Eh, Mr. Grady...

content.text: JACK clears his throat.

content.line: haven't I seen you somewhere before?
Why no, sir.  I don't believe so.

content.text: GRADY turns cam.L to basins to rinse serviette under tap. He turns back to JACK and sponges his jacket.

content.line: Ah ha, it's coming off now, sir.
Eh... Mr. Grady... weren't you once the caretaker here?
Why no, sir.  I don't believe so.

content.text: GRADY sponges JACK's trousers.

content.line: You er a married man, are you, Mr. Grady?

content.text: GRADY sponges JACK's jacket sleeve.

content.line: Yes, sir.  I have a wife and eh two daughters, sir.
And, er... where are they now?
Oh, they're somewhere around.  I'm not quite sure at the moment, sir.

content.text: JACK takes serviette away from GRADY and wipes his hand with it.

content.line: Mr. Grady, you were the caretaker here.  I recognize you.  I saw your picture in the newspapers.  You eh... chopped your wife and daughters up into little bits, and eh... and you blew your brains out.

content.text: JACK throws serviette into basin cam.L.
M.L.S. GRADY over JACK.

content.line: That's strange, sir.  I don't have any recollection of that at all. Mr. Grady, you were the caretaker here.

content.text: M.S. JACK over GRADY.

content.line: I'm sorry to differ with you, sir, but you are the caretaker.  You have always been the caretaker, I should know, sir.  I've always been here.

content.text: M.C.S. JACK laughs.

content.line: Did you know, Mr. Torrance, that your son... is attempting to bring an outside party into this situation? Did you know that?

content.text: M.C.S. JACK.  He shakes his head.

content.line: No.
He is, Mr. Torrance.
Who?
A nigger.
A nigger!
A nigger cook.
How?
Your son has a very great talent. I don't think you are aware how great it is, but he is attempting to use that very talent against your will.
Well, he is a very willful boy.

content.text: JACK smiles.

content.line: Indeed, he is, Mr. Torrance.  A very willful boy.  A rather naughty boy, if I may be so bold, sir.

content.text: M.C.S. JACK.  He looks about.

content.line: It's his mother.

content.text: JACK looks about.

content.line: She eh... interferes.
Perhaps they need a good talking to, if you don't mind my saying so. Perhaps a bit more.
My girls, sir, they didn't care for the Overlook at first.  One of them actually stole a packet of matches
and tried to burn it down.  But I corrected them, sir.  And when my wife tried to prevent me from doing my duty I corrected her.

content.text: M.C.S. JACK smiles.
WENDY, crying and holding cigarette, walks R-L from Living Room into Bedroom.  CAMERA PANS with her.

content.line: (to herself) We have the Snowcat.  If the weather breaks, we might just be able to get down the mountain in that.

content.text: WENDY turns and walks L-R back into LIVING ROOM - CAMERA TRACKS IN and PANS with her.

content.line: (to herself) I could call the Forest Rangers first and then tell them that we're coming so that they could start searching for us, in case we didn't make it.

content.text: WENDY turns and walks R-L into Bedroom - CAMERA PANS with her.

content.line: (to herself) If Jack won't come with us, we'll just have to tell him that we are going by ourselves.  That's all there is to it.
Red Rum.  Red Rum.

content.text: WENDY reacts and turns to cam.R.  She runs away to DANNY's bedroom door in b.g.

content.line: Red Rum.  Red Rum.

content.text: WENDY opens door and stands in doorway.

content.line: Danny?
Red Rum.  Red Rum.  Red Rum.

content.text: WENDY moves R-L from door.  CAMERA PANS with her and TRACKS BACK to reveal DANNY sitting up in bed.  WENDY sits beside him.

content.line: Red Rum.
Danny... what's the matter, hon?
Red Rum.
Are you having a bad dream?

content.text: M.C.S. DANNY over WENDY

content.line: Danny?  Hon?
Danny's not here, Mrs. Torrance.

content.text: M.C.S. WENDY over DANNY

content.line: Come on, hon, wake up.  You just had a bad dream.  Everything's okay.

content.text: M.C.S. DANNY over WENDY.

content.line: Danny can't wake up, Mrs. Torrance.

content.text: M.C.S. WENDY over DANNY.

content.line: Danny, wake up!  Come on, right now,

content.text: M.C.S. DANNY over WENDY.

content.line: Wake up.
Danny's gone away, Mrs. Torrance.

content.text: M.C.S. WENDY over DANNY.

content.line: Danny...

content.text: She leans forward and puts her arm round him.  She strokes his hair.
JACK walking L-R past reception desk.  CAMERA TRACKS with him to office.  He goes in and switches on lights.

content.line: (over radio) This is KDK 1 calling KDK 12.  KDK 1 calling KDK 12.  Are you receiving me?  This is KDK 1 calling KDK 12. KDK 1 calling KDK 12.  Do you read me?

content.text: JACK walks from office into inner office.  CAMERA TRACKS after him.  He stops by radio set.

content.line: (over radio) This is KDK 1 calling KDK 12.  KDK 1  calling KDK 12.  Are you receiving me?

content.line: (over radio) KDK 1 calling KDK 12.  KDK 1 calling KDK 12.  Do you read me?

content.line: (over radio) This is KDK 1 calling KDK 12.  KDK 1 calling KDK 12.

content.line: (over radio) Are you recei...

scene: INT. MIAMI - HALLORAN'S APARTMENT - NIGHT - M.S.

content.text: HALLORAN, phone to ear, walks R-L towards window.  CAMERA PANS with him.

content.line: (over phone) Good evening.  Forest Service.
(into phone) Hallo, this is Dick Halloran again. I called a while ago about the folks at the Overlook Hotel.

content.text: RANGER sitting at radio, phone to ear.

content.line: (into phone) Oh yeah.  We tried to contract them several times by radio, but they didn't answer.

content.text: MAN enters from cam.R.f.g. and walks away to b.g.

content.line: (into phone) Now, maybe they've got their radio turned off or they're in a place where they can't hear it.  If you like me to, I'd be glad to try them again later on.

scene: INT. MIAMI - HALLORAN'S APARTMENT - NIGHT - M.S.

content.text: HALLORAN, phone to ear.

content.line: (into phone) Oh, that's very nice of you.  I'll call you back later.  Bye.

content.text: He walks L-R.  CAMERA TRACKS & PANS with him.  He puts phone down on receiver, and puts his hand up to his head.

8 a.m.
D.C.10 in flight.

We're due to arrive at 8:20, sir.
Thank you very much.
